intro: Silene vulgaris f. sersuensis, commonly known as the redstem sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pink to reddish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are linear and often covered with fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Silene vulgaris f. sersuensis is an important component of the local flora and plays a role in supporting pollinators and other wildlife.
